raw_text:
Scrum-half Williams rejoins Bath
 
 Bath have signed their former scrum-half Andy Williams on a short-term deal from the Neath-Swansea Ospreys.
 
 Wales international Williams, whose contract with the Welsh region was due to expire in June, has agreed a contract until the end of the season. With Martyn Wood's injury likely to keep him out until February, Bath need experienced back-up to Nick Walshe. Said Williams: "When this opportunity presented itself, I did not really have to think twice about it." Williams, capped by Wales against Romania in 2003, should figure in the match squad for Monday's Zurich Premiership match at Sale Sharks. He lost his Ospreys starting place to New Zealander Jason Spice and has fallen further behind in the pecking order. The Welsh region has two outstanding young No 9 prospects in Richie Rees and Rhodri Wells. Bath director of rugby Jack Rowell, though, believes Williams fits the bill perfectly. "He has been playing regular Heineken Cup and Celtic League rugby and he has a great affection for Bath," Rowell told Bath's official website. "We are delighted to be able to welcome him back to the club."

He will provide experience and backup for Nick Walshe, who is out until February due to injury. Williams has been capped by Wales since 2003 but lost his starting place at Ospreys.

With Martyn Wood's injury likely keeping him out until February, Bath need experienced back-up for Nick Walshe. Williams, who had lost his starting position at Ospreys to Jason Spice and is now further down the pecking order, will feature in the match squad for the upcoming Zurich Premiership match against Sale Sharks. He expressed enthusiasm about returning to Bath. The club's director of rugby, Jack Rowell, confirmed that Williams fits their needs perfectly due to his regular Heineken Cup and Celtic League experience and his fondness for the team.

Andy Williams has rejoined the Bath rugby team, having previously been on the bench from Neath-Swansea Ospreys due to his contract ending in June. He was capped by Wales against Romania last year and replaced Jason Spice with falling behind in the pecking order. The team director, Jack Rowell, praised Williams for his regular involvement in competitions and suitability as a backup player, expressing confidence that he would fit seamlessly into the club's rugby program.
tinyllama:1.1b: Bath have re-signed Bath scrum-half Andy Williams on a short-term deal from Neath-Swansea Ospreys until the end of the season. The Welsh region has two outstanding young No 9 prospects in Richie Rees and Rhodri Wells, but Bath director of rugby Jack Rowell sees Williams as perfect for their back-up plan. "He has been playing regular Heiniken Cup and Celtic League rugby," Rowell said, "and we're delighted to welcome him back to the club."

With Martyn Wood's injury likely to keep him out until February, Bath need experienced back-up for Nick Walshe, as well as someone to fill the gap left by Williams' departure. Williams, capped by Wales against Romania in 2003, will figure in the match squad for Monday's Sale Sharks clash at the University of Southampton Stadium. With Rees and Wells ahead of him in the pecking order, Williams has a place on the bench.
